text: for the New York Times and the
International Herald Tribune this is
Suzy Menkes in Paris at the first show
that Phoebe Philo has done for Saline
this is your first time back on the
runway in four years how do you feel
what I've done today really comes from
my stomach it's a real gut response to
fashion I like my clothes to be
practical and functional and easy and
beautiful and wearable but there's a bit
of alter ego in there too there's a bit
of a woman that I hope one day I can be
there was a military feel to this
collection not just in those April let's
and the style but also in the way the
models marched out at such a pace
I always feel grounded when I see
military garments so kind of referencing
them felt like a wholesome place to
start
the feeling of military came from some
men's proportions as well that were in
the arm holes in the sleeves all were
coming from a large man shirt which is
something I love I mean I love women
wearing that men's wear I find it very
intriguing
is it important to you that your clothes
can be worn by yourself I have a strange
relationship with the clothes I design
which is as soon as I've done them I
almost can't revisit them I think it's
part of my drive to keep on going I kind
of like them to look anonymous and to
really blend in with me and not be on me
but certainly what keeps me going is
this is is what's next what can I do
next but it comes from a sense of us
wanting to wear something
